verses.roman:
govinda-prekṣaṇākṣepi-
bāṣpa-pūrābhivarṣiṇam
uccair anindad ānandam
aravinda-vilocanā

synonyms: govinda—of Lord Govinda; prekṣaṇa—the seeing; ākṣepi—hindering; bāṣpa-pūra—groups of tears; abhivarṣiṇam—which cause to rain; uccaiḥ—powerfully; anindat—condemned; ānandam—the bliss; aravinda-vilocanā—the lotus-eyed Rādhārāṇī.
translation: "The lotus-eyed Rādhārāṇī powerfully condemned the ecstatic love that caused a flow of tears that hindered Her sight of Govinda."

purport.content: This verse is also from Bhakti-rasāmṛta-sindhu (2.3.54).
